intro: Ipomoea hildebrandtii subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the Chinese morning glory, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil. The species is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and climbers.
